title: What is the origin of the English royal house of Tudor? Were they Welsh? - Quora

response.answer_text: Henry VII’s father, Edmund Tudor, was Welsh, but Henry’s mother, Lady Margaret Beaufort, was a great-grandaughter of John of Gaunt. (Her grandfather, John of Beaufort, had been born illegitimate, but had been officially legitimized by both the Pope and the King after his parents were married.) It was a tenuous connection, but it made him part of the Lancaster branch of the Plantagenet family, with a chance to challenge Richard III. He was also smart enough to hold on to the crown once he got it.

The first Tudor king was Henry VII - who had one Welsh grandparent, one French grandparent, and two English grandparents. The Welsh one was his father’s father, which is why the family name was Welsh. Henry VII married an English wife, so Henry VIII was even less Welsh.
Yes, the Tudors were descended from a Welsh family who lived in Penmynydd, Anglesey (North Wales). This is a photo of the house (Plas Penmynydd):  Penmynydd - birthplace of royalty
